poem:
Title: Translucent Walls of Human Law

One echoes soundlessly in Turkey's liminal space,
Father, once familiar, entrapped in a nestled place. 
Separation sweats its bitter salts, a desiccated face,
Love prolongs - between two hearts, a daunting chase. 
In official corridors, forgotten names manoeuvre maze,
Among the ink and seals, one plea casts its gaze.
Judicial review, oh, silent Sphinx of our days.
